They also use computers to conduct research, prepare lesson plans, and grade assignments. For students, computers are essential for completing homework, conducting research, and collaborating on projects. Without the internet, it would be extremely difficult, if not impossible, to access the vast amount of information available today.  In conclusion, computers are a remarkable technological advancement that has had a profound impact on society. They have made our lives easier, more efficient, and more connected. My final reason for opposing computers is that people become addicted to the allure of the digital world. This addiction can lead to estrangement from friends and family as individuals become immersed in the virtual realm. Additionally, personal hygiene and proper nutrition may be neglected. The so - called computer is akin to a drug that causes one to lose touch with reality. Once again, I firmly say no to computers. I have presented my opinion and three supporting arguments, namely identity theft, cyberbullying, and addiction. Say no to computers.

Dear Newspaper, I wholeheartedly concur with the experts on computers. Proponents of technological advancements assert that computers have a positive influence on individuals. While these benefits are valid, there are numerous negative impacts that are often overlooked. Prolonged computer use can impair vision due to the proximity to the screen. Moreover, computers are highly addictive for many people worldwide, leading to a sedentary lifestyle and contributing to the prevalent issue of obesity. Personally, I am of the opinion that individuals should curtail their computer usage. There are several reasons for this. Firstly, excessive computer use often leads to a lack of physical activity. People tend to spend an inordinate amount of time on computers and neglect exercise. This sedentary lifestyle can result in weight gain and various health problems. Instead of sitting in front of a computer, individuals should engage in activities such as running or going to the gym. Even if one has home exercise equipment, it is still preferable to use it rather than remain glued to the computer screen. If people dedicated as much time to exercise as they do to computers, the average weight of humans would significantly decrease. Secondly, excessive computer use prevents people from appreciating nature. Spending long hours indoors in front of a computer means missing out on the fresh air and natural beauty outside. I, for one, would much rather be outside playing baseball and staying fit than sitting inside getting overweight. Even viewing nature through a computer screen cannot compare to the real experience of being outdoors. If people spent as much time enjoying nature as they do on computers, our world would be a healthier and cleaner place. Finally, computer addiction can lead to a decline in social interaction with family and friends. People may isolate themselves in a dark room, ignoring their loved ones while engrossed in the digital world. This is not only detrimental to relationships but also to one's emotional well - being. If a person spends all their time on the computer, they will gradually lose touch with the people who matter most to them. In conclusion, it is evident that people would be better off spending more time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends rather than indulging in excessive computer use. Even if one currently spends only a small amount of time on the computer, there is a risk of gradually increasing usage until it becomes all - consuming.

Dear Local Newspaper, My perspective on the impact of computers on people is that computers have a positive influence. They are beneficial for education, mental stimulation, and global communication. However, they can also be detrimental as they may prevent you from engaging in physical activity, spending time with your family, and maintaining good health. Nevertheless, I firmly believe that there are ways to utilize computers without incurring these negative consequences. One of the advantages of computers is that they provide access to a vast amount of information on websites, which can enhance your education. Although some of this information may be inaccurate, by identifying reliable websites, you can obtain the correct information. With this wealth of knowledge, you can exercise your mind to achieve greater success in life. Moreover, you can communicate with individuals on the other side of the world and gain additional insights from them. If I were to argue that computers are harmful, I would contend that they impede you from getting sufficient, or perhaps any, physical exercise. Computers may be the reason for the high prevalence of obesity in our society. When computers are overused, people distance themselves from their families and immerse themselves in virtual worlds that can sometimes lead to addiction. Prolonged computer use can also cause various problems. Sitting at a computer for an extended period can result in physical harm. Excessive computer use can also lead to eye problems, such as vision loss, which may require the use of glasses that become thicker over time as you continue to stare at the screen for hours and days on end. However, despite these issues, we can mitigate the negative effects of computers by using them in a responsible manner. People often lack sufficient exercise, but with the help of computers, they can find suitable times and methods to stay active. They can also access information on how much time should be spent on the computer to avoid vision deterioration. For individuals who live far away from their families, computers are invaluable for maintaining communication and staying connected. In conclusion, I believe that the benefits of computers outweigh the drawbacks, as they offer a wealth of information and facilitate global communication. Moreover, computers can help us prevent the negative impacts by providing guidance on how to use them safely.

Typing is also advantageous for those with poor penmanship, as they can use computers to type essays, homework, and school projects. This makes it easier for both students and teachers to read the assignments. Despite the many advantages of computers, there are also disadvantages. An increasing number of children are spending their free time on computers rather than engaging in outdoor exercise, leading to a decrease in physical activity. Spending excessive time in chat rooms is also a drawback. Children today are using a new language in chat rooms and while texting, employing abbreviations for words and phrases, such as "idk" for "I don't know." This language is having a detrimental impact on children's reading and writing abilities. Although chat rooms on computers can be useful, they can also be dangerous. Both children and adults enter chat rooms and provide false information about themselves, such as their age. Some adults pretend to be teenagers in chat rooms and interact with children until they obtain personal information like addresses, phone numbers, schools, and districts. Once they acquire such information, they can learn a great deal about the children. This is extremely dangerous, and unfortunately, it has occurred. As evident, computers offer both advantages and disadvantages. I believe that if people can strike a balance between them, there will be greater consensus regarding computers. In my opinion, computers are useful but also pose risks. If children are more cautious online and spend more time outdoors, there will be less controversy. Parents will be less concerned about their children's safety and health if children use computers solely for homework and are careful about whom they interact with online. Additionally, the content children post in their profiles should be carefully considered. If these measures are taken, a balance will be achieved, and over time, people will become less extreme in their views, and they will feel more at ease.

Computers are an extraordinary technological advancement in life. Their significance lies in the fact that they assist a multitude of individuals and occupations. Among those benefited are school - children, who can use computers to research areas relevant to worksheet questions. Moreover, the police, @CAPS1.W.A.T, and the @ORGANIZATION1 also rely on computers. The police and @CAPS1.W.A.T utilize computers to track the whereabouts of individuals and predict their future locations. The @ORGANIZATION1 employs computers to determine attack or defense positions. Without computers, it would have been impossible to locate @CAPS3 @CAPS4. However, there are negative aspects associated with computers. Hackers and individuals overly addicted to computers are a concern. These individuals are so obsessed that they seem inseparable from their computers. This situation can be attributed to parental negligence. These are the primary drawbacks of computers. Excessive computer use can lead to physical inactivity and weight gain as people prefer to stay on the computer rather than engage in physical activities. On the positive side, computers offer a means to reconnect with family and friends over the years. They also control a wide range of crucial aspects, including nuclear bombs, security systems, secret - files, satellites, all of @CAPS5.A.@CAPS1.A., and more. In essence, they play a major role in controlling various aspects of life. It is ironic when a father, who was once a popular and active person in his youth, realizes that his son has become a computer - dependent nerd. In such cases, a responsible father will attempt to help his son, and these efforts can sometimes yield positive results. This is an example of good parenting, as it involves intervening when a child shows excessive computer - related behavior. In contrast, some parents allow their children unrestricted computer use. These are my perspectives on the positive and negative aspects of computers.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, Computers exert a positive influence on individuals. Despite the fact that people may be less physically active outdoors, computers offer numerous benefits. Computers contribute to the development of hand - eye coordination, are convenient, and enable interaction with diverse individuals online. Undoubtedly, computers play a role in teaching hand - eye coordination. The internet hosts numerous websites that teach children to type. Typing helps children familiarize themselves with the alphabet, recognize the appearance of letters, and learn the location of keys on the keyboard. Additionally, there are other websites where the computer interacts with users. Moreover, there are many children and even adults with dyslexia who struggle with letter recognition, but there are software programs that can identify the letters they type. Thus, computers effectively teach hand - eye coordination. Have you ever been a student who received a poor grade on a paper due to messy handwriting? Using a computer is a more convenient option, as it can make your assignment as neat as possible. Firstly, computers are convenient because answers to any question are just a click away. Secondly, there is no need to spend money on purchasing books for research; one can conduct free online research. Finally, it is convenient for teachers and employers, as papers can be submitted via email. Receiving a paper by email is much easier than dealing with hand - written samples. Computers offer convenience in multiple ways. Computers also enable people to engage in video chats and online conversations. Firstly, many families have members living in different locations, and computers allow them to see each other online without leaving their state. Secondly, there are families with military members who have not seen each other in person for years but can communicate online. Lastly, many students and teachers participate in online learning and teaching, which is convenient for those with busy schedules. Therefore, online interaction is made possible through computers. As can be seen, computers have a positive impact. They teach hand - eye coordination, facilitate online chatting, and are highly convenient. So, the next time you plan to visit the library to research a book, consider staying at home and conducting the same research online.

I am of the opinion that having computers in a household is a prudent idea. They offer opportunities for gaming, learning, and communication, among other things. Here are three reasons to support this view. Firstly, computers are excellent for gaming. There is a vast array of games to choose from, including card games, board games, and even @NUM1 games. Dear editor, computers are beneficial to people as they significantly assist with work, homework, and other tasks.

On a computer, you cannot jog off the excess fat accumulated from consuming food. By choosing to jog instead of using the computer, you can shed weight and experience the real world rather than the virtual one on the computer screen.  Nevertheless, computers can be entertaining, such as when playing addictive games. However, isn't it more rewarding to participate in a real - life sport like soccer? In soccer, you have to utilize your intellect extensively, making it far superior to sitting or lying in a daze in front of a computer screen for a long duration. This clearly demonstrates the detrimental impact of computers on society.  When a person is online, there are few restrictions. The internet offers access to an infinite number of websites, not all of which are trustworthy. The online realm is populated by millions of unrelated individuals, i.e., strangers. Interacting with strangers can be extremely perilous as they may have a negative influence, and there is no guarantee of safety unless the person is a teacher or of a similar authoritative position. Unfortunately, it is impossible to fully trust anyone online as their true identity is often unknown. For example, on Facebook, users may believe their profiles are private, but in reality, much of the content they upload or post is accessible to the public. Even non - friends can view a person's profile, which poses a significant security risk.  The rate of internet addiction is also on the rise. Those addicted to the internet tend to stay indoors and avoid outdoor activities. This lack of exercise is extremely unhealthy, and they often rely on fast food for meals, which further exacerbates the problem. As a result, people who spend excessive time on computers are prone to weight gain due to an unbalanced diet and a lack of interaction with the outside world and nature.  In conclusion, computers have a negative impact on society. They contribute to an increase in the number of people with impaired eyesight, create an unsafe online environment, and lead to unbalanced diets and a sedentary lifestyle.

I harbor skepticism regarding the assertion that computers confer benefits upon society. While children have the potential to acquire substantial knowledge, they often squander excessive time online. When engaging in online conversations, it becomes arduous to ascertain the true identity of the interlocutor. Moreover, computers are plagued by technical glitches that can result in the deletion of crucial files. These factors collectively undermine the purported benefits of computers to society.  Children are prone to spending an inordinate amount of time on computers. Although computers can serve as valuable educational tools, they also offer a plethora of games that tend to captivate children's attention. Consequently, children often prioritize gaming over studying, leading to a decline in academic performance. Additionally, the sedentary nature of computer use can contribute to a lack of physical exercise, which may result in aggression and weight gain. Children may also lose interest in other activities, becoming overly reliant on computers for entertainment.  Another significant concern is the issue of online safety. When children interact with strangers online, they are at risk of divulging personal information to malicious individuals. These individuals may create fake email addresses and false accounts on social media platforms to deceive children and gain access to their personal details. This can lead to identity theft, cyberbullying, and other forms of online exploitation.  Furthermore, computers are vulnerable to viruses and malware, which can cause significant damage to files and data. When a computer is infected with a virus, it may delete important files, corrupt data, or even render the computer inoperable. This can be particularly problematic for individuals who rely on their computers for work, school, or personal use.  In conclusion, while computers offer certain advantages, such as access to information and the ability to communicate with others, their negative impacts on society cannot be overlooked. It is imperative that parents, educators, and policymakers take proactive measures to address these issues and ensure that children use computers in a safe and responsible manner. By promoting digital literacy, setting limits on screen time, and implementing strict online safety measures, we can mitigate the risks associated with computer use and harness its potential for positive change.

Dear @CAPS1, I believe there are several reasons why technological advancements can be detrimental to our society. Firstly, they expose individuals to strangers in the outside world. Secondly, they detract from time spent with family and friends. Lastly, they prevent people from fully enjoying life beyond the digital realm. One of the primary reasons I perceive advanced technology as harmful to society is that it provides access to strangers, including teenagers, adults, and others. The issue lies in the fact that one can never truly ascertain the identity of the person on the other side of the digital "door." In chat rooms, individuals may mislead others into believing they are someone they are not. For instance, there is a show called Dateline. This program depicts how young teenagers post personal information online. Grown or young men click on their pictures, initiating a chat, which is akin to opening a door without knowing who is on the other side. These men manipulate the teens into trusting them and feeling secure. They may ask, "Can I come over sometime?" The unsuspecting teen, believing the person to be a friend, often agrees. Remember, they may not have seen the person's picture. In many cases, these men have ulterior motives. This is what occurs on the Dateline TV show, and one can only imagine how many other kids or teens are engaging in similar behavior without being caught. Another reason why technology is harmful to society is that it distances individuals from their family and friends. It creates a perception among family members, especially children, that one values the computer more than them. It also causes a rift with friends, as one may decline invitations to go to the mall or for a drink in favor of checking something online. Gradually, relationships will deteriorate, and one will lose those who are most important. My final reason for the potential harm of technology to society is that it discourages individuals from living their own lives and pursuing their interests. The online world is filled with trends that others claim are "cool." One should follow their own instincts. For example, if someone posts that @NUM1 guys think London is amazing and one should visit, but you've always dreamed of going to @LOCATION1, follow your own desires. Moreover, excessive time online can lead to a lack of outdoor activity, resulting in a pale complexion and a general sense of lethargy. In conclusion, while some may view advanced technology as beneficial, it is evident that it exposes individuals to danger, isolates them from loved ones, and prevents them from living a fulfilling life.
